intro: Jussiaea myrtifolia subf. longifolia, commonly known as the long-leaved jussiaea, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Brazil. It belongs to the family Onagraceae and is characterized by its slender, herbaceous stems and opposite leaves that are often lanceolate in shape. The plant produces small, pink to white flowers arranged in clusters, which bloom during the warmer months. Its ornamental value makes it a sought-after plant for botanical gardens and conservation efforts.
